intro: Hemitelia moricandiana, commonly known as the Moricandia hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
